items.creator: Paul Ducklin
items.title: Mozilla turns off “Firefox Send” following malware abuse reports
items.dc:creator: Paul Ducklin
items.content: Sadly, the easier and safer you make your file sharing service, the more attractive it becomes to the crooks.
items.contentSnippet: Sadly, the easier and safer you make your file sharing service, the more attractive it becomes to the crooks.

items.creator: Lisa Vaas
items.title: Kinda sorta weakened version of EARN IT Act creeps closer
items.dc:creator: Lisa Vaas
items.content: Critics say the amended bill that's headed for a full Senate hearing still threatens encryption, albeit less blatantly.
items.contentSnippet: Critics say the amended bill that's headed for a full Senate hearing still threatens encryption, albeit less blatantly.

items.creator: Paul Ducklin
items.title: Company web names hijacked via outdated cloud DNS records
items.dc:creator: Paul Ducklin
items.content: Why hack into a server when you can just send vistors to a fake alternative instead?
items.contentSnippet: Why hack into a server when you can just send vistors to a fake alternative instead?

items.creator: Lisa Vaas
items.title: Flashy Nigerian Instagram star extradited to US to face BEC charges
items.dc:creator: Lisa Vaas
items.content: It's a short jump from a Rolls Royce ride to extradition from the UAE. Goodbye, Dubai, goodbye, Palazzo Versace, hello, Chicago jail cell.
items.contentSnippet: It's a short jump from a Rolls Royce ride to extradition from the UAE. Goodbye, Dubai, goodbye, Palazzo Versace, hello, Chicago jail cell.

items.creator: Lisa Vaas
items.title: Boston bans government use of facial recognition
items.dc:creator: Lisa Vaas
items.content: To help end systemic racism, we'll stay away from an error-prone technology that's been shown to have racial bias, the city council said.
items.contentSnippet: To help end systemic racism, we'll stay away from an error-prone technology that's been shown to have racial bias, the city council said.

items.creator: Naked Security writer
items.title: Monday review – the hot 11 stories of the week
items.dc:creator: Naked Security writer
items.content: Get yourself up to date with everything we've written in the last seven days - it's weekly roundup time.

items.creator: Paul Ducklin
items.title: Facebook hoaxes back in the spotlight – what to tell your friends
items.dc:creator: Paul Ducklin
items.content: At the risk of giving you a feeling of déjà vu all over again, it's time to talk about Facebook hoaxes once more.
items.contentSnippet: At the risk of giving you a feeling of déjà vu all over again, it's time to talk about Facebook hoaxes once more.

items.creator: Lisa Vaas
items.title: Google buys AR smart-glasses company North
items.dc:creator: Lisa Vaas
items.content: They're not surveillance spectacles, says Google, just a piece in the jigsaw of "ambient computing", where helpfulness is all around you.
items.contentSnippet: They're not surveillance spectacles, says Google, just a piece in the jigsaw of "ambient computing", where helpfulness is all around you.

items.creator: Paul Ducklin
items.title: MongoDB ransom threats step up from blackmail to full-on wiping
items.dc:creator: Paul Ducklin
items.content: Still thinking "the crooks probably won't find me if I make a security blunder"?
items.contentSnippet: Still thinking "the crooks probably won't find me if I make a security blunder"?

items.creator: Lisa Vaas
items.title: 133m records for sale as fruits of data breach spree keep raining down
items.dc:creator: Lisa Vaas
items.content: Databases can be had for as little as $100, on up to $1,100. Most, if not all, are being sold by the hacking group Shiny Hunters.
items.contentSnippet: Databases can be had for as little as $100, on up to $1,100. Most, if not all, are being sold by the hacking group Shiny Hunters.
